skill.name: prometheus-configuration
skill.description: Set up Prometheus for comprehensive metric collection, storage, and monitoring of infrastructure and applications. Use when implementing metrics collection, setting up monitoring infrastructure, or configuring alerting systems.
skill.summary: Set up Prometheus for comprehensive metric collection, storage, and monitoring of infrastructure and...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only documentation and configuration examples. No code execution, network calls, or data access behaviors are present.

content.value_statement: Setting up Prometheus can be complex and error prone. This skill provides clear configuration examples for scraping, rules, and validation.
actual_capabilities: Provide Helm installation steps for Kubernetes deployments
Provide Docker Compose setup for Prometheus
Show a complete prometheus.yml example with scrape configs
Provide recording rule examples for common metrics
Provide alert rule examples with labels and annotations
List promtool validation commands for configs and rules
limitations: Does not execute commands or validate configurations automatically
Does not include actual template files referenced in the text
Does not generate Grafana dashboards or SLOs
Does not tailor rules to specific business SLAs

use_cases.title: Bootstrap monitoring stack
use_cases.description: Use provided Helm and configuration examples to deploy Prometheus for a new cluster.

use_cases.title: Define alert rules
use_cases.description: Adapt alert rule patterns for availability, latency, and resource usage monitoring.

use_cases.title: Expose app metrics
use_cases.description: Configure a job scrape block for application endpoints with TLS settings.

prompt_templates.title: Start Prometheus setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a simple prometheus.yml with one scrape job for my app and explain the key fields.

prompt_templates.title: Add recording rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create recording rules for HTTP request rate, error rate, and p95 latency with clear names.

prompt_templates.title: Build alert rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft alert rules for service down, high error rate, and high latency with labels and annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Kubernetes discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a scrape_config for Kubernetes pods using prometheus.io annotations and relabeling.

output_examples.input: Create alert rules for high CPU and low disk space.
output: High CPU alert triggers after 5 minutes above 80 percent.
Low disk alert triggers after 5 minutes above 90 percent usage.
Each alert includes severity labels and a clear summary message.

best_practices: Use consistent metric naming and labels across jobs
Set scrape intervals appropriate for system load and retention
Validate configs and rules with promtool before deploy
anti_patterns: Scraping too frequently without storage planning
Using alert rules without labels or annotations
Skipping recording rules for expensive queries

faq.question: Is this compatible with Kubernetes and Docker?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes Helm and Docker Compose setup examples.

faq.question: What limits should I know?
faq.answer: It provides examples only and does not run or validate commands.

faq.question: Can I integrate with Grafana or Alertmanager?
faq.answer: The configuration shows Alertmanager targets and assumes Grafana for visualization.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it only provides documentation and sample configurations.

faq.question: What if promtool reports errors?
faq.answer: Check file paths, YAML syntax, and rule expressions for typos.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic Prometheus guides?
faq.answer: It focuses on actionable configuration patterns and rule examples.
